ai.summary: A challenging 20.6 km parish walk in the UK featuring rural lanes, fields and country footpaths around Fillongley. The route is long and exposed with uneven terrain, gates and stiles, and a mix of mud and dry sections. Plan roughly 4–6 hours depending on pace and conditions.
ai.terrain_summary: Rural mix of grassy fields, muddy footpaths, dry lanes, and a few road sections. Expect uneven ground, variable traction, gates and stiles, and occasional overgrown sections. The elevation gain is spread across the distance, with little natural shade in open stretches.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast and avoid the route in severe conditions. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and dress in layers suitable for the UK weather. Carry a map and compass or GPS, and ensure your phone is charged. Let someone know your planned route and estimated finish time. Bring water and snacks, and stay hydrated. Be cautious on road sections and give way to traffic. Watch for livestock on farmland and take care around gates and stiles. In case of emergency, dial 999 or 112; carry a whistle to signal for help.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
ai.best_seasons: Spring and Autumn are best for this hike due to milder temperatures and daylight; Summer is possible in dry conditions, but can be hot; Winter is not recommended because of mud and shorter daylight.

seo.title: NAHT Parish Walk Fillongley – 20.6 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Tackle a challenging 20.6 km hard hike on the NAHT Parish Walk Fillongley route in the UK. Rural lanes, fields, and gates with elevation and mud potential. Gear and safety tips included.
seo.h1: NAHT Parish Walk Fillongley – 20.6 km (Hard Difficulty)
